snippet: As China’s leader emphasized quality of economic growth over a set target, the government reported poor performance in areas like industrial output during January and February.
abstract: China reports that retail, manufacturing and investment all slowed in the beginning of 2014, raising questions about country's ability to achieve growth targets as it tries to reform its economy; Premier Li Keqiang, responding to report, emphasizes quality of growth over set targets, noting that goals are flexible.
lead_paragraph: As China’s leader emphasized quality of economic growth over a set target, the government reported poor performance in areas like industrial output during January and February.

headline.main: Its Growth Targets Elusive, China Focuses on Jobs and Quality of Life
headline.print_headline: Its Growth Targets Elusive, China Focuses on Jobs and Quality of Life
